cloudcode.welcomeViews.kubernetesNoClust:
Get started with Kubernetes in Cloud Code by adding a cluster to your KubeConfig. Clicking the button below is a good place to start, even if you don't have a cluster already.
[Add a cluster to the KubeConfig](command:cloudcode.addClusterToConfig)
Alternatively, if you already have a KubeConfig file, you can [load the file](command:cloudcode.switchKubeConfig).
cloudcode.welcomeViews.gcloudLogin:
Please login to the Google Cloud SDK to continue. If you don't have an account yet, you can get started with a [free trial](https://cloud.google.com/free).
[Login to Google Cloud SDK](command:cloudcode.gke.runGcloudAuth)
cloudcode.welcomeViews.gcloudSelectProje:
Please select a Google Cloud project continue. If you don't have a project yet, you can create one in [Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/projectcreate).
[Select a project](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject)
If you want to select a project in another account, you can [sign out](command:cloudcode.gke.gcloudSignout) and sign back in.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.explorerEnableRun:
In order to use Cloud Run on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Cloud Run API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/run.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Cloud Run API](command:cloudcode.runExplorer.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has this API enabled.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.explorerEnableSec:
In order to use Secret Manager on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Secret Manager API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/secretmanager.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Secret Manager API](command:cloudcode.secretmanagerExplorer.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has this API enabled.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.explorerEnableCon:
In order to use GKE on Google Cloud, you need to enable the [Kubernetes Engine API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/container.googleapis.com).
Consuming Google Cloud APIs may incur additional billing charges. You can learn more by clicking the above link.
[Enable Kubernetes Engine API](command:cloudcode.containerExplorer.enableApi)
Alternatively, you can [switch projects](command:cloudcode.sharedExplorer.chooseProject) to a project that already has this API enabled.
cloudcode.welcomeViews.localDevExplorerG:
Run or debug your kubernets app using the options in the title bar or the options below.
[Create a Kubernetes sample](command:cloudcode.createK8sAppExplorerTitle)
[Run on Kubernetes](command:cloudcode.runK8sAppExplorerTitle)
[Debug on Kubernetes](command:cloudcode.debugK8sAppExplorerTitle)
